description: From the Ancient Greek τοπάρχης (topárkhēs, “ruler of a small district”), from τόπος (tópos, “place”) +‎ -αρχης (-arkhēs, “ruler”). Compare the Latin toparcha and French toparque.

entries.meaning: The prince or ruler of a small district, city, or petty state; a petty "king".
examples: The toparchs of India and Ethiopia.
